snippet: Antonis Samaras, Greece’s prime minister, says an agreement will be reached that will end speculation that the country will leave the euro. But business leaders say they have seen little progress.
abstract: Greek Prime Min Antonis Samaras says agreement will be reached that will end speculation that the country will leave the euro zone; business leaders say they have seen little progress.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and LIZ ALDERMAN

lead_paragraph: Antonis Samaras, Greece’s prime minister, says an agreement will be reached that will end speculation that the country will leave the euro. But business leaders say they have seen little progress.

headline.seo: ‘We Will Make It,’ Greek Leader Says
headline.main: Prime Minister Emphasizes His Belief That Greece Will Stay in European Union
headline.print_headline: Prime Minister Emphasizes His Belief That Greece Will Stay in European Union
